Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of Nereus’s right hand and left arm and hand extended to right; at right, black framing line and glazed handle zone.
Curator's comments: This sherd of a small panel amphora (probably a neck-amphora) joins Boston 88.827 and British Museum 1965,0930.844, and belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1965,0930.843, Brighton and Hove Museum HA281488 and Reading, Ure Museum 26.2.74-75, 26.2.76 and 26.2.77. See Williams, D. 'In the Manner of the Gorgon Painter: the Deianeira Painter and Others’, in H. A. G. Brijder, A. A. Drukker and C. W. Neeft (eds) Enthousiasmos. Essays on Greek and Related Pottery presented to J. M. Hemelrijk. Amsterdam 1986, 61-8, esp. 62-65, fig. 4.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0014) (Phase 1)
